result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J Nieuwenhuis

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 19, 2023 at 09:30 am.

(Cases 22CF291, 22CF1152 are called at 9:59 AM) Defendant David J Nieuwenhuis in court, in custody with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defense indicates there will be an agreement but they cannot proceed today with a plea hearing. State has no objection to rescheduling. Victim S.K. makes a statement. 
Status Conference: 01/19/2023 at 9:30 AM (IN PERSON).
Plea hearing on October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 1:32 PM. Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant David J Nieuwenhuis appeared by video.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared by video for David J Nieuwenhuis.  Attorney Robert W. Stoiber appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defendant waives his right to personal appearance.  
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
Attorney Kelm requests the matter be set for Plea Hearing 45 days out.
Plea Hearing: 10/27/22 at 10:00 AM (in person).

9:40 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David J Nieuwenhuis in court with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Branch 3 for scheduling Arraignment

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David J Nieuwenhuis in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for David J Nieuwenhuis. Attorney Kelm was appointed yesterday; new dates requested. Settlement Conference: 06/29/22 at 2pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David J Nieuwenhuis in court without counsel.
Defendant requests time to retain an attorney.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/23/22 at 1:30 PM.
Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 4-4-22 at 1:30 PM. Return to court: 4-26-22 at 9:30 AM.
